actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, the Internet, and Intellectual Property.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Courts, the Internet, and Intellectual Property

official_title: To amend title 28, United States Code, to limit Federal court jurisdiction over State laws restricting pornography, and for other purposes.
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: The Pornography Jurisdiction Limitation Act of 2008 - Amends the federal judicial code to provide that no court created by Act of Congress shall have jurisdiction, and the Supreme Court shall have no appellate jurisdiction, to hear or decide a question of whether a state pornography law imposes a constitutionally invalid restriction on the freedom of expression. Provides that a decision of a federal court, to the extent the decision relates to such a question, is not binding precedent on a state court.

titles.title: To amend title 28, United States Code, to limit Federal court jurisdiction over State laws restricting pornography, and for other purposes.
